name: Urethra T
title: Clinical and Pathologic T
notes:
**Note 1:**  In case of multifocal noninvasive Ta and Tis tumors, assign Tis. 

**Note 2:**  If assigned Tis, then Behavior code ICD-O-3 must be /2.

**Note 3:**  The presence of muscle around the urethra varies between males and females and, in males, varies among the segments of the urethra. The outer muscular coat (muscularis) is absent in most of the male urethra except for the membranous portion. In females, the muscle coat is continuous from the bladder wall. In addition, in both males and females, there is sphincteric muscle, which may be smooth or skeletal muscle. Invasion of periurethral muscle is assigned T1, unless it is specified as invasion of sphincter muscle, which is assigned T2. Invasion of muscle at the neck of the bladder is assigned T3. If the only information is "invasion of muscle", NOS, or "invasion of periurethral muscle", NOS, assign T1.
rows:
Unknown; extension not stated
Not documented in patient record
Non-invasive papillary, polypoid, or verrucous carcinoma
Carcinoma in situ, involvement of prostatic ducts
Intraepithelial, noninvasive: involvement of prostatic ducts
Carcinoma in situ, involvement of prostatic urethra
Intraepithelial, noninvasive: involvement of prostatic urethra

Subepithelial connective tissue (lamina propria, submucosa) invaded

Localized, NOS

Stated as T1

Tumor invades any of the following: 
Corpus spongiosum
Prostate
Periurethral muscle

Muscularis invaded

Sphincter muscle; periurethral muscle specified as sphincter

Stated as T2

Tumor invades any of the following: 
Corpus cavernosum 
Beyond prostatic capsule 
Bladder neck (extraprostatic extension)

Vagina, anterior or NOS

Stated as T3

Tumor invades other adjacent organs (invasion of
the bladder)

Other adjacent organs, including
    Bladder (excluding bladder neck)
    Seminal vesicle(s)

Further contiguous extension

Stated as T4
